messages.message: Hey team, anyone else running into rabbitmq `ConnectionRefusedError` in api-server logs and not having their CAT pickup tasks? All my services are being run with env-local secrets and I restarted rabbitmq with `brew services restart rabbitmq` - any other tips on how to resolve this?
Yep app-tasks is up, along with all services in `lite`

running rabbitmq that way also crashed for me, also I thought building and running rabbitmq that way was deprecated, so we switched to `brew services restart rabbitmq`. Like the `ppy compile rabbitmq` command doesn't exist anymore
Alrighty, unblocked for now bc an older branch of mine is working well with rabbitmq
seems to be an erlang OOM error? https://lists.rabbitmq.com/pipermail/rabbitmq-discuss/2012-September/022679.html
cc @gurkirat @Anil if you can offer any tips?

Looks like this is crafting?
If it is just local - you can use plain python to check the brew rabbitmq is reachable. Maybe something similar in crafting.
We don’t have ppy rabbitmq anymore.
When Pauline tried to run brew rabbitmq, it crashed (see her screenshot above)
I don’t think Pauline is using crafting, unless she just switched to it
The paths in the screenshot are /home/ibuser/<> - which is an ubuntu style path. Mac paths are /Users/anil/<>
